Articles.Content:
My Munar shipyard is finally taking shape. Rockets built here will be used for interplanetary manned and unmanned mission, Duna being my first target. (Maybe Minimus, only have a satellite there so far) I'm only using Damned Robotics mad for this. The "Kerhemoth Crane" is my biggest rover/mechanism I've built in the game so far, and I sent to to the Mun! I'm still all smiles right now haha. Here are some pictures of it's journey to my Mun base, along with my first rocket component for the shipyard.

hahaha, it's got so much muscle, I can pick up Kerbin!

The Kerbalnauts are in awe of what just pulled up to their Mun base........

Can't wait to put it in action!

Here is the final masterpiece! Not building on the Mun until .21 is released.

This took so many hours of trial and error and banging my head on the desk.

This is my Duna Lander ship!

All of the extra landing gear and supports for the main rocket come off upon launch. I can't wait to use it!

First test in Kerbin gravity didn't go so well......

But it will definitely work in Mun's gravity
Wow! There's no way I would of thought of something so amazing, but still good job!
hey psycho, how did it go with landing the SSTO on the mun?

Wow! There's no way I would of thought of something so amazing, but still good job!

I'm doing this because I'm terrible at docking in orbit

I have attempted a shipyard (a rather basic one) for a space station. However, docking the Orbital Construction Pod (since it might've had ASAS as well as the space station itself) caused all sorts of problems. This was during the time 0.18 just came out too.

I'm holding out on building future space stations anyhow until a later version.

And very nice job on that shipyard.

I hate it when I get a stroke of genius that makes my last idea obsolete.....It's going to make mum shipyard logistics much easier, using much less equipment. I'm not near my computer this week, but it involves building it flat, then tipping it upright without and cables or mechanisms.
Whackjob would rage if he saw you got this thing into orbit...
